intro: Meniscium hosei, commonly known as the Japanese meniscus, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
